subject: Technology
title: Loot Boxes: Gambling in Disguise?
description: A micro-lesson that makes Loot Boxes: Gambling in Disguise? usable.

hook.text: Pay $2 for a mystery box. You might get a rare item worth hundreds, or worthless junk. Sound like gambling?

buildup.text: Loot boxes appeared in games like FIFA and Overwatch. Players pay real money for randomized virtual rewards.

discovery.text: The randomness triggers the same brain chemistry as slot machines. The near-miss keeps you buying.

twist.text: Belgium banned loot boxes as illegal gambling. Other countries investigated but most took no action.

climax.text: The loot box debate forced the industry to confront whether games are exploiting vulnerable players.

punchline.text: Games learned gambling mechanics. The debate is far from over.

quiz.question: Why are loot boxes compared to gambling?
options: Players pay real money for randomized rewards, triggering similar brain responses
They require players to be over 21
